item.title: The Spritzes and Carbonaras That Ate Italy
item.description: Tourism has turned some Italian streets into monochromatic eating zones. Some officials have banned the opening of new restaurants.

item.title: AI startups are leasing luxury apartments in San Francisco for staff and offering large rent stipends to attract talent
item.description: The average rent increase in San Francisco leads all other cities in the past year, according to real estate data.

item.title: World Menopause Day: support women, strengthen systems
item.description: On World Menopause Day, bringing menopause out of the shadows is not a niche concern but a public priority.

item.title: U.S. jury issues $20 million verdict against France’s largest bank over Sudanese atrocities
item.description: A spokesperson for BNP Paribas said in an email the result “is clearly wrong and there are very strong grounds to appeal the verdict.”

item.title: Sea Otters Are Stealing Surfboards in Santa Cruz. Again.
item.description: Two years after Otter 841 menaced wave riders near Santa Cruz, there have been new encounters between the furry marine mammals and surfers.

item.title: Large Fire Disrupts Flights at Bangladesh’s Main Airport
item.description: The blaze drew dozens of firefighting units, with military help. Officials said they could not yet specify what caused it.
